title: Nominations to the Senate: Michael Selig for CFTC Chairman and Commissioner; Withdrawal: Joel Rayburn
summary: The White House announced nominations to the Senate for Michael Selig, of Florida, to be Chairman of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission, replacing Rostin Behnam, and to be a Commissioner of the CFTC for a term expiring April 13, 2029, replacing Christy Goldsmith Romero. The announcement also notes a withdrawal from consideration for Joel Rayburn.

title: Presidential Proclamation on Regulatory Relief for Certain Stationary Sources to Support American Mineral Security
summary: This proclamation emphasizes the strategic importance of copper to the United States' energy, defense, and manufacturing sectors and identifies domestic copper smelting capacity as a priority for reducing reliance on foreign supply chains. It announces regulatory relief targeted at certain stationary sources to enhance American mineral security by supporting domestic copper production and strengthening supply resilience.

title: Nomination of Jennifer Wicks McNamara, of Virginia, to be Ambassador Extraordinary and Plenipotentiary of the United States to the Socialist Republic of Vietnam
summary: The White House announced that Jennifer Wicks McNamara, a resident of Virginia, has been nominated to serve as the United States ambassador extraordinary and plenipotentiary to the Socialist Republic of Vietnam, with the nomination transmitted to the Senate for its consideration.

title: Proclamation Designating National Day of Remembrance for Charlie Kirk
summary: A presidential proclamation designates a National Day of Remembrance to honor the memory of Charlie Kirk following his death on September 10, 2025, and directs nationwide observances and commemorative activities. The proclamation specifies the purpose of the day and encourages participation across the country.
